data.PINT_IDs: ibg-25 ibg-20 ibg-21 ibt-151 ibt-95 ibt-102 ibg-23 ibt-118
data.CommonRules: An Invoice that contains an Invoice line (ibg-25), a Document level allowance (ibg-20) or a Document level charge (ibg-21) where the VAT category code (ibt-151, ibt-95 or ibt-102) is “Standard rated” shall contain in the VAT breakdown (ibg-23) at least one VAT category code (ibt-118) equal with "Standard rated".

An Invoice that contains an Invoice line (ibg-25) where the Invoiced item VAT category code (ibt-151) is “Standard rated” shall contain the Seller VAT Identifier (ibt-31), the Seller tax registration identifier (ibt-32) and/or the Seller tax representative VAT identifier (ibt-63).

An Invoice that contains a Document level allowance (ibg-20) where the Document level allowance VAT category code (ibt-95) is “Standard rated” shall contain the Seller VAT Identifier (ibt-31), the Seller tax registration identifier (ibt-32) and/or the Seller tax representative VAT identifier (ibt-63).

An Invoice that contains a Document level charge (ibg-21) where the Document level charge VAT category code (ibt-102) is “Standard rated” shall contain the Seller VAT Identifier (ibt-31), the Seller tax registration identifier (ibt-32) and/or the Seller tax representative VAT identifier (ibt-63).
In an Invoice line (ibg-25) where the Invoiced item VAT category code (ibt-151) is "Standard rated" the Invoiced item VAT rate (ibt-152) shall be greater than zero.
In a Document level allowance (ibg-20) where the Document level allowance VAT category code (ibt-95) is "Standard rated" the Document level allowance VAT rate (ibt-96) shall be greater than zero.
In a Document level charge (ibg-21) where the Document level charge VAT category code (ibt-102) is "Standard rated" the Document level charge VAT rate (ibt-103) shall be greater than zero.

data.PINT_IDs: ibt-119 ibt-118 ibt-116 ibg-23 ibt-131 ibt-99 ibt-92 ibt-151 ibt-102 ibt-95 ibt-152 ibt-103 ibt-96 ibt-119
data.CommonRules: For each different value of VAT category rate (ibt-119) where the VAT category code (ibt-118) is "Standard rated", the tax category taxable amount (ibt-116) in a VAT breakdown (ibg-23) shall equal the sum of Invoice line net amounts (ibt-131) plus the sum of document level charge amounts (ibt-99) minus the sum of document level allowance amounts (ibt-92) where the VAT category code (ibt-151, ibt-102, ibt-95) is “Standard rated” and the VAT rate (ibt-152, ibt-103, ibt-96) equals the VAT category rate (ibt-119).

The VAT category tax amount (ibt-117) in a VAT breakdown (ibg-23) where VAT category code (ibt-118) is "Standard rated" shall equal the tax category taxable amount (ibt-116) multiplied by the VAT category rate (ibt-119).
A VAT breakdown (ibg-23) with VAT Category code (ibt-118) "Standard rate" shall not have a VAT exemption reason code (ibt-121) or VAT exemption reason text (ibt-120).
GLN must have a valid format according to GS1 rules.
Norwegian organization number MUST be stated in the correct format.
Danish organization number (CVR) MUST be stated in the correct format.
Mime code must be according to subset of IANA code list.
Reason code MUST be according to subset of UNCL 5189 D.16B.
Reason code MUST be according to UNCL 7161 D.16B.
Invoice period description code must be according to UNCL 2005 D.16B.
Currency code must be according to ISO 4217:2005
Electronic address identifier scheme must be from the code list "Electronic Address Identifier Scheme"
A date MUST be formatted YYYY-MM-DD.
Invoice type code MUST be set according to the profile.
Credit note type code MUST be set according to the profile.
Business process MUST be provided.
No more than one note is allowed on document level.
A buyer reference or purchase order reference MUST be provided.
Specification identifier MUST have the value 'urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017#compliant#urn:fdc:peppol.eu:2017:poacc:billing:3.0'.
VAT accounting currency code MUST be different from invoice currency code when provided.
Only one invoiced object is allowed on document level
Business process MUST be in the format 'urn:fdc:peppol.eu:2017:poacc:billing:NN:1.0' where NN indicates the process number.
Document MUST not contain empty elements.
Buyer electronic address MUST be provided
Seller electronic address MUST be provided
Allowance/charge amount must equal base amount * percentage/100 if base amount and percentage exists
Allowance/charge base amount MUST be provided when allowance/charge percentage is provided.
Allowance/charge percentage MUST be provided when allowance/charge base amount is provided.
Allowance/charge ChargeIndicator value MUST equal 'true' or 'false'
Charge on price level is NOT allowed. Only value 'false' allowed.
Item net price MUST equal (Gross price - Allowance amount) when gross price is provided.
All currencyID attributes must have the same value as the invoice currency code (BT-5), except for the invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111)
Only one tax total with tax subtotals MUST be provided.
Only one tax total without tax subtotals MUST be provided when tax currency code is provided.
Invoice total VAT amount and Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency MUST have the same operational sign
Mandate reference MUST be provided for direct debit.
Only one project reference is allowed on document level
Only one invoiced object is allowed per line
Element Document reference can only be used for Invoice line object
Start date of line period MUST be within invoice period.
End date of line period MUST be within invoice period.
Invoice line net amount MUST equal (Invoiced quantity * (Item net price/item price base quantity) + Sum of invoice line charge amount - sum of invoice line allowance amount
Base quantity MUST be a positive number above zero.
Unit code of price base quantity MUST be same as invoiced quantity.

UBL-CR-001 to UBL-CR-679 refer to elements that exist in the OASIS UBL Invoice schema, however are not used in PEPPOL BIS Billing 3.0. If one of these elements is used, a warning message will be generated, other than UBL-CR-666 and UBL-CR-673 which are fatal errors.
[UBL-CR-666]-A UBL invoice should not include an AdditonalDocumentReference simultaneously referring to an Invoice Object Identifier and an Attachment.
[UBL-CR-673]-A UBL invoice should not include an AdditionalDocumentReference simultaneously referring an Invoice Object Identifier and an Document Description
[UBL-DT-01]-Amounts shall be decimal up to zero fraction digits
These rules will apply for the A-NZ extension. Refer to EN16931 model bound to UBL rules for details.
[UBL-DT-06]-Binary object elements shall contain the mime code attribute
[UBL-DT-07]-Binary object elements shall contain the file name attribute
Contract identifier shall occur maximum once.
Receive advice identifier shall occur maximum once
Despatch advice identifier shall occur maximum once
Invoice object identifier shall occur maximum once
Payment terms shall occur maximum once
Preceding invoice reference shall occur maximum once
If there is a preceding invoice reference, the preceding invoice number shall be present
Invoice period shall occur maximum once
Seller name shall occur maximum once
Seller trader name shall occur maximum once
Seller legal registration identifier shall occur maximum once
[UBL-SR-12]-Seller VAT identifier shall occur maximum once
[UBL-SR-13]-Seller tax registration shall occur maximum once
Seller additional legal information shall occur maximum once
Buyer name shall occur maximum once
Buyer identifier shall occur maximum once
Buyer legal registration identifier shall occur maximum once
[UBL-SR-18]-Buyer VAT identifier shall occur maximum once
Payee name shall occur maximum once, if the Payee is different from the Seller
Payee identifier shall occur maximum once, if the Payee is different from the Seller
Payee legal registration identifier shall occur maximum once, if the Payee is different from the Seller
Seller tax representative name shall occur maximum once, if the Seller has a tax representative
[UBL-SR-23]-Seller tax representative VAT identifier shall occur maximum once, if the Seller has a tax representative
Deliver to information shall occur maximum once
Deliver to party name shall occur maximum once
Payment reference shall occur maximum once
Payment means text shall occur maximum once
Mandate reference identifier shall occur maximum once
Bank creditor reference shall occur maximum once
Document level allowance reason shall occur maximum once
Document level charge reason shall occur maximum once
[UBL-SR-32]-VAT exemption reason text shall occur maximum once
UBL-SR-33 to UBL-SR-37 apply for the A-NZ extension. Refer to EN16931 model bound to UBL rules for details.
Invoice line note shall occur maximum once
Referenced purchase order line identifier shall occur maximum once
Invoice line period shall occur maximum once
Item price discount shall occur maximum once
[UBL-SR-38]-Invoiced item VAT exemption reason text shall occur maximum once
Project reference shall occur maximum once.
Buyer trade name shall occur maximum once
N/A
Party tax scheme shall occur maximum twice in accounting supplier party
Scheme identifier shall only be used for invoiced object (document type code with value 130)
Payment ID shall occur maximum once
Due Date shall occur maximum once
Payment means text shall occur maximum once
When there are more than one payment means code, they shall be equal
Invoice lines shall have one and only one classified tax category.
Value tax point date shall occur maximum once
Item description shall occur maximum once
